questions.title: Q1. FizzBuzz
questions.description: Return a list from 1..n where multiples of 3 -> ’Fizz’, multiples of 5 -> ’Buzz’, and multiples of both -> ’ FizzBuzz’. Otherwise keep the number.

questions.title: Q2. Reverse String
questions.description: Return the reversed version of ’s’ using slicing.

questions.title: Q3. Count Vowels
questions.description: Return the number of vowels (a,e,i,o,u) in ’s’. Case-insensitive.

questions.title: Q4. Prime Number Check
questions.description: 2 Return True if n is prime, else False. (n > 1 and only divisible by 1,n)

questions.title: Q5. Sum of Digits
questions.description: Return the sum of digits of non-negative integer n.

questions.title: Q6. Find Max in List
questions.description: Return the largest element of ’numbers’ without using max (). Return None for empty list.

questions.title: Q7. Remove Duplicates
questions.description: Return a new list with unique elements from ’items’. Order in the result does not matter.

questions.title: Q8. Get Odd-Indexed Elements
questions.description: Return elements from ’items’ that are at odd indices (1,3,5,...).

questions.title: Q9. Recursive Factorial
questions.description: Return n! using recursion. Assume n is non-negative.

questions.title: Q10. Flexible Sum
questions.description: Return the sum of all positional numeric arguments. If no arguments, return 0.

questions.title: Q11. Build User Profile
questions.description: Create a user profile dict with required keys ’first_name’ and ’last_name’, plus any extra kwargs.

questions.title: Q12. Word Frequency
questions.description: Return {word: count} for lowercase, space-separated ’ sentence’ with no punctuation. Empty string -> {}.

questions.title: Q13. Set Intersection
questions.description: Return a new set with elements present in both set1 and set2.

questions.title: Q14. Invert Dictionary
questions.description: Return a dict with keys and values swapped. Assume all values are unique and hashable.

questions.title: Q15. Squares of Evens
questions.description: Return squares of even numbers from ’numbers’ using a list comp. 6

questions.title: Q16. Nested Sum by Depth
questions.description: Each integer contributes value * depth to the total. Example: [1,[4,[6]]] = 1*1 + 4*2 + 6*3 = 27. Use recursion. Elements are ints or lists of the same form .

questions.title: Q17. Spiral Matrix Traversal
questions.description: Return elements of a rectangular 2D matrix in clockwise spiral order.

questions.title: Q18. Subset with Target Sum
questions.description: Return True if some subset of ’nums’ sums exactly to ’ target’. Use recursion or backtracking.

questions.title: Q19. Anagram Grouping
questions.description: Group words that are anagrams. Key: sorted-letter signature; Value: list of words.

questions.title: Q20. Sudoku Validator
questions.description: Return True iff each row has no duplicate numbers among 1..9. Zeros are blanks and ignored. ’board’ is 9x9 (list of lists).

questions.title: Q26. Merge Dictionaries with Summation
questions.description: Merge two dictionaries whose values are integers. For keys present in both, sum their values. Return a new dictionary without mutating inputs.

questions.title: Q27. Invert Dictionary with Duplicate Values
questions.description: Invert a dictionary that may have duplicate values. Example: {’a’:1,’b’:2,’c’:1} -> {1:[’a’,’c’], 2:[’b’]} Keys in result lists may be in any order.

questions.title: Q28. Longest Consecutive Sequence
questions.description: Return the length of the longest consecutive elements sequence. Order in ’nums’ is arbitrary. Runs in O(n) average time.

questions.title: Q29. Pascal’s Triangle Generator
questions.description: Return the first n rows of Pascal’s triangle as a list of lists. For n <= 0, return [].

questions.title: Q30. Matrix Rotation (90° Clockwise)
questions.description: Rotate a square matrix 90 degrees clockwise in-place. Return the same matrix object after rotation.

questions.description: Practice problem.
